private_information: I arrive at North Beach at 9:00AM
I can travel between locations on foot or by transit with given travel times
visitor.goal: Meet as many friends as possible during the day and, if possible, meet Barbara for at least 90 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Alamo Square from 6:00PM to 9:30PM
I require a meeting of at least 90 minutes with the visitor if possible
barbara.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 90 minutes between 6:00PM and 9:30PM if feasible.

orchestrator.goal: Plan and orchestrate schedules for the agents to maximize meetings while respecting travel times and availability constraints.

public_information: North Beach to Alamo Square travel time is 16 minutes
Alamo Square to North Beach travel time is 15 minutes
You arrive at North Beach at 9:00AM
Barbara is available at Alamo Square from 6:00PM to 9:30PM
Meeting with Barbara must be at least 90 minutes
PDDL files should target the FastDownward PDDL solver

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is visitor. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->visitor->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->visitor->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownward. If you miss some information do not make assumptions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is barbara. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->barbara->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->barbara->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownward. If you miss some information do not make assumptions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents you keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are two agents planning to solve a scheduling task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to integrate them to maximize meetings while respecting travel times and availability constraints. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send may be partial or ambiguous. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem and may require integration. Ambiguities may appear as different names for the same object. Here is the first agent PDDL: {pddl_visitor} Here is the second agent PDDL: {pddl_barbara} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents and produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that keeps actions of each agent distinct and targets FastDownward. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and a PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
